flowcharts.csv:
## See more information for the syntax at https://drawio-app.com/import-from-csv-to-drawio/ ## ## Example CSV. Use ## for comments and # for configuration. ## The following names are reserved and should not be used (or ignored): ## id, tooltip, placeholder(s), link and label (see below) ## # ## Node label with placeholders and HTML. ## Default is '%name_of_first_column%'. # # label: %name%
%position%
Email # ## Node style (placeholders are replaced once). ## Default is the current style for nodes. # # style: label;image=%image%;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;rounded=1;fillColor=%fill%;strokeColor=%stroke%; # ## Parent style for nodes with child nodes (placeholders are replaced once). # # parentstyle: swimlane;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;childLayout=stackLayout;horizontal=1;horizontalStack=0;resizeParent=1;resizeLast=0;collapsible=1; # ## Optional column name that contains a reference to a named style in styles. ## Default is the current style for nodes. # # stylename: - # ## JSON for named styles of the form {"name": "style", "name": "style"} where style is a cell style with ## placeholders that are replaced once. # # styles: - # ## Optional column name that contains a reference to a named label in labels. ## Default is the current label. # # labelname: - # ## JSON for named labels of the form {"name": "label", "name": "label"} where label is a cell label with ## placeholders. # # labels: - # ## Uses the given column name as the identity for cells (updates existing cells). ## Default is no identity (empty value or -). # # identity: - # ## Uses the given column name as the parent reference for cells. Default is no parent (empty or -). ## The identity above is used for resolving the reference so it must be specified. # # parent: - # ## Adds a prefix to the identity of cells to make sure they do not collide with existing cells (whose ## IDs are numbers from 0..n, sometimes with a GUID prefix in the context of realtime collaboration). ## Default is csvimport-. # # namespace: csvimport- # ## Connections between rows ("from": source colum, "to": target column). ## Label, style and invert are optional. Defaults are '', current style and false. ## If placeholders are used in the style, they are replaced with data from the source. ## An optional placeholders can be set to target to use data from the target instead. ## In addition to label, an optional fromlabel and tolabel can be used to name the column ## that contains the text for the label in the edges source or target (invert ignored). ## The label is concatenated in the form fromlabel + label + tolabel if all are defined. ## The target column may contain a comma-separated list of values. ## Multiple connect entries are allowed. # # connect: {"from": "manager", "to": "name", "invert": true, "label": "manages", \ # "style": "curved=1;endArrow=blockThin;endFill=1;fontSize=11;"} # connect: {"from": "refs", "to": "id", "style": "curved=1;fontSize=11;"} # ## Node x-coordinate. Possible value is a column name. Default is empty. Layouts will ## override this value. # # left: # ## Node y-coordinate. Possible value is a column name. Default is empty. Layouts will ## override this value. # # top: # ## Node width. Possible value is a number (in px), auto or an @ sign followed by a column ## name that contains the value for the width. Default is auto. # # width: auto # ## Node height. Possible value is a number (in px), auto or an @ sign followed by a column ## name that contains the value for the height. Default is auto. # # height: auto # ## Padding for autosize. Default is 0. # # padding: -12 # ## Comma-separated list of ignored columns for metadata. (These can be ## used for connections and styles but will not be added as metadata.) # # ignore: id,image,fill,stroke,refs,manager # ## Column to be renamed to link attribute (used as link). # # link: url # ## Spacing between nodes. Default is 40. # # nodespacing: 40 # ## Spacing between levels of hierarchical layouts. Default is 100. # # levelspacing: 100 # ## Spacing between parallel edges. Default is 40. Use 0 to disable. # # edgespacing: 40 # ## Name or JSON of layout. Possible values are auto, none, verticaltree, horizontaltree, ## verticalflow, horizontalflow, organic, circle or a JSON string as used in Layout, Apply. ## Default is auto. # # layout: auto # ## ---- CSV below this line. First line are column names. ---- name,position,id,location,manager,email,fill,stroke,refs,url,image Evan Miller,CFO,emi,Office 1,,me@example.com,#dae8fc,#6c8ebf,,https://www.draw.io,https://cdn3.iconfinder.com/data/icons/user-avatars-1/512/users-9-2-128.png Edward Morrison,Brand Manager,emo,Office 2,Evan Miller,me@example.com,#d5e8d4,#82b366,,https://www.draw.io,https://cdn3.iconfinder.com/data/icons/user-avatars-1/512/users-10-3-128.png Ron Donovan,System Admin,rdo,Office 3,Evan Miller,me@example.com,#d5e8d4,#82b366,"emo,tva",https://www.draw.io,https://cdn3.iconfinder.com/data/icons/user-avatars-1/512/users-2-128.png Tessa Valet,HR Director,tva,Office 4,Evan Miller,me@example.com,#d5e8d4,#82b366,,https://www.draw.io,https://cdn3.iconfinder.com/data/icons/user-avatars-1/512/users-3-128.png

flowcharts.xml: <mxfile host="app.diagrams.net" modified="2021-07-20T08:20:09.353Z" agent="5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_14_6) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/14.1.1 Safari/605.1.15" etag="WWRrqEoBq2d6hs0RaQJw" version="14.9.0" type="embed"><diagram id="dmEdr83iY6YnOyjyLwFb" name="Page-1"></diagram></mxfile>

targets.query: SELECT "Fault"  FROM "Huawei_stat" where 'Status' != null order by time desc limit 1
SELECT "State1"  FROM "Huawei_stat" where 'Status' != null order by time desc limit 1
SELECT "State2"  FROM "Huawei_stat" where 'Status' != null order by time desc limit 1
SELECT  "State3"  FROM "Huawei_stat" where 'Status' != null order by time desc limit 1
SELECT  "Status"  FROM "Huawei_stat" where 'Status' != null order by time desc limit 1
SELECT "Insulation" FROM "Huawei_info" WHERE $timeFilter and "Insulation" > 0
SELECT max("Temp") FROM "Huawei" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1d) fill(previous)
select mean(q) from (SELECT (mean("U_A-B") -  mean("M_U_AB"))  / mean("I_A")  as q FROM "Huawei" WHERE ("I_A" > 15) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1d) fill(null))
SELECT "M_P" FROM "Huawei" WHERE $timeFilter ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1 tz('${tzone}')
SELECT cumulative_sum(integral("power90")) * 1.0  /3600   FROM "forcast" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(linear)
SELECT mean("P_daily") FROM "Huawei" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(none)
SELECT cumulative_sum(integral("power"))   /3600 * 1.0  FROM "forcast" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(linear)
SELECT cumulative_sum(integral("power10"))   /3600 * 1.0  FROM "forcast" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(linear)
SELECT cumulative_sum(integral("M_P")) /3600 / 1000  FROM "Huawei" WHERE $timeFilter and "M_A-U" != 0 GROUP BY time($__interval)  fill(linear)
SELECT (integral("power90"))   /1800  FROM "forcast" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(linear)
SELECT mean("P_active")  as prod FROM "Huawei" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT (integral("power"))   /1800  FROM "forcast" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(linear)
SELECT (integral("power10"))   /1800  FROM "forcast" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(linear)

flowcharts.csv:
## See more information for the syntax at https://drawio-app.com/import-from-csv-to-drawio/ ## ## Example CSV. Use ## for comments and # for configuration. ## The following names are reserved and should not be used (or ignored): ## id, tooltip, placeholder(s), link and label (see below) ## # ## Node label with placeholders and HTML. ## Default is '%name_of_first_column%'. # # label: %name%
%position%
Email # ## Node style (placeholders are replaced once). ## Default is the current style for nodes. # # style: label;image=%image%;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;rounded=1;fillColor=%fill%;strokeColor=%stroke%; # ## Parent style for nodes with child nodes (placeholders are replaced once). # # parentstyle: swimlane;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;childLayout=stackLayout;horizontal=1;horizontalStack=0;resizeParent=1;resizeLast=0;collapsible=1; # ## Optional column name that contains a reference to a named style in styles. ## Default is the current style for nodes. # # stylename: - # ## JSON for named styles of the form {"name": "style", "name": "style"} where style is a cell style with ## placeholders that are replaced once. # # styles: - # ## Optional column name that contains a reference to a named label in labels. ## Default is the current label. # # labelname: - # ## JSON for named labels of the form {"name": "label", "name": "label"} where label is a cell label with ## placeholders. # # labels: - # ## Uses the given column name as the identity for cells (updates existing cells). ## Default is no identity (empty value or -). # # identity: - # ## Uses the given column name as the parent reference for cells. Default is no parent (empty or -). ## The identity above is used for resolving the reference so it must be specified. # # parent: - # ## Adds a prefix to the identity of cells to make sure they do not collide with existing cells (whose ## IDs are numbers from 0..n, sometimes with a GUID prefix in the context of realtime collaboration). ## Default is csvimport-. # # namespace: csvimport- # ## Connections between rows ("from": source colum, "to": target column). ## Label, style and invert are optional. Defaults are '', current style and false. ## If placeholders are used in the style, they are replaced with data from the source. ## An optional placeholders can be set to target to use data from the target instead. ## In addition to label, an optional fromlabel and tolabel can be used to name the column ## that contains the text for the label in the edges source or target (invert ignored). ## The label is concatenated in the form fromlabel + label + tolabel if all are defined. ## The target column may contain a comma-separated list of values. ## Multiple connect entries are allowed. # # connect: {"from": "manager", "to": "name", "invert": true, "label": "manages", \ # "style": "curved=1;endArrow=blockThin;endFill=1;fontSize=11;"} # connect: {"from": "refs", "to": "id", "style": "curved=1;fontSize=11;"} # ## Node x-coordinate. Possible value is a column name. Default is empty. Layouts will ## override this value. # # left: # ## Node y-coordinate. Possible value is a column name. Default is empty. Layouts will ## override this value. # # top: # ## Node width. Possible value is a number (in px), auto or an @ sign followed by a column ## name that contains the value for the width. Default is auto. # # width: auto # ## Node height. Possible value is a number (in px), auto or an @ sign followed by a column ## name that contains the value for the height. Default is auto. # # height: auto # ## Padding for autosize. Default is 0. # # padding: -12 # ## Comma-separated list of ignored columns for metadata. (These can be ## used for connections and styles but will not be added as metadata.) # # ignore: id,image,fill,stroke,refs,manager # ## Column to be renamed to link attribute (used as link). # # link: url # ## Spacing between nodes. Default is 40. # # nodespacing: 40 # ## Spacing between levels of hierarchical layouts. Default is 100. # # levelspacing: 100 # ## Spacing between parallel edges. Default is 40. Use 0 to disable. # # edgespacing: 40 # ## Name or JSON of layout. Possible values are auto, none, verticaltree, horizontaltree, ## verticalflow, horizontalflow, organic, circle or a JSON string as used in Layout, Apply. ## Default is auto. # # layout: auto # ## ---- CSV below this line. First line are column names. ---- name,position,id,location,manager,email,fill,stroke,refs,url,image Evan Miller,CFO,emi,Office 1,,me@example.com,#dae8fc,#6c8ebf,,https://www.draw.io,https://cdn3.iconfinder.com/data/icons/user-avatars-1/512/users-9-2-128.png Edward Morrison,Brand Manager,emo,Office 2,Evan Miller,me@example.com,#d5e8d4,#82b366,,https://www.draw.io,https://cdn3.iconfinder.com/data/icons/user-avatars-1/512/users-10-3-128.png Ron Donovan,System Admin,rdo,Office 3,Evan Miller,me@example.com,#d5e8d4,#82b366,"emo,tva",https://www.draw.io,https://cdn3.iconfinder.com/data/icons/user-avatars-1/512/users-2-128.png Tessa Valet,HR Director,tva,Office 4,Evan Miller,me@example.com,#d5e8d4,#82b366,,https://www.draw.io,https://cdn3.iconfinder.com/data/icons/user-avatars-1/512/users-3-128.png

flowcharts.xml: <mxfile host="app.diagrams.net" modified="2021-08-03T07:02:33.393Z" agent="5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_14_6) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/14.1.2 Safari/605.1.15" etag="iOAtdYujCTT5GzZ_x4Xb" version="14.9.2" type="embed"><diagram id="5sR0j5sy5Hubi7MNRoeB" name="Page-1"></diagram></mxfile>

targets.query: SELECT cumulative_sum(integral("power"))   /3600 * 1.0  FROM "forcast" WHERE $timeFilter and time <= now() GROUP BY time(1d) fill(linear)
select max(p) from (SELECT last("P_daily") as p FROM "Huawei" WHERE $timeFilter ) GROUP BY time(1d)
SELECT max("P_daily") -  first("P_daily")  FROM "Huawei" WHERE time >= now() - 24h and  time <= ${__from}ms GROUP BY time(1d) fill(previous) order by time asc limit 1
SELECT cumulative_sum(integral("power")) /3600  as yet  FROM "forcast" WHERE time > now() and time < ${__to}ms  GROUP BY time(1d)
select max(p) from (SELECT last("P_peak") as p FROM "Huawei" WHERE $timeFilter ) GROUP BY time(1d)

SELECT last("M_PTot") - first("M_PTot") as "from grid",  last("M_PExp") - first("M_PExp") as "export",  first("M_PTot") - last("M_PTot") + last("M_PExp") - first("M_PExp") as "balance", last("P_active")  as "Inverter",  last("P_daily") - (first("M_PTot") - last("M_PTot") + last("M_PExp") - first("M_PExp")) as "load",  last("P_daily") - (last("M_PExp") - first("M_PExp")) as self_consumed FROM "Huawei" WHERE  $timeFilter  fill(previous) order by time asc

select last(CBal) + last(DBal) as Year_Bal from (select cumulative_sum(diff)  as DBal from (SELECT ("P_Exp") - ("P_Grid") + ("Adj") as diff FROM "Huawei_daily"  fill(0)) where time > '${__to:date:YYYY-MM-18}' -60d), (select cumulative_sum(Bal) as CBal from Huawei_daily where time > now() -365d ) fill(previous)
SELECT "State3" FROM "Huawei_stat" order by time desc limit 1
SELECT min("M_P")/(-1000) as peak FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > ${__from}ms  fill(none)
SELECT last("PV_Un") FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > ${__from}ms -10m  fill(none)
SELECT last(/load_(\d)/)  FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 3d  fill(null)
SELECT mean("M_A-U") FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > ${__from}ms -10m  fill(0)
SELECT max("P_active") * 1000 FROM "Huawei" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("P_active") * 1000 FROM "Huawei" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT (integral("power"))   /1.8  FROM "forcast" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(linear)
SELECT mean("M_P") - mean("P_active") * 1000 FROM "Huawei" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT last(load_0)  FROM "Huawei" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time(30s) fill(none)
SELECT last(load_1)  FROM "Huawei" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time(30s) fill(none)
SELECT last(load_2)  FROM "Huawei" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time(30s) fill(none)
SELECT last("P_active") FROM "Huawei" WHERE P_active > 0 and time > now() - 1h  GROUP BY time(30s) fill(null)
SELECT (integral("power"))  / 1800  FROM "forcast" WHERE time > now() - 2h and time < now() + 1h GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(linear)
SELECT last("M_P") / 1000 - last("P_active")  FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 1h  GROUP BY time(30s) fill(null)
SELECT last("M_P") / 1000 FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 1h  GROUP BY time(30s) fill(null)
SELECT last("load_0") FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 1h  GROUP BY time(30s) fill(null)
SELECT last("load_1") FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 1h  GROUP BY time(30s) fill(null)
SELECT last("load_2") FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 1h  GROUP BY time(30s) fill(null)
SELECT last("P_active") FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 5m  GROUP BY time(1m) fill(none)
SELECT (last("M_P")  /1000  - last("P_active")) as p FROM "Huawei" WHERE  time > now() - 5m  GROUP BY time(1m) fill(none)
SELECT last("M_P")  / 1000 FROM "Huawei" WHERE  time > now() - 5m GROUP BY time(1m) fill(none)
SELECT cumulative_sum(integral("M_P")) / 3600 / 1000 FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 1h  GROUP BY time(1m) fill(none)
SELECT min("M_P")/(-1000) as peak FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > ${__from}ms  fill(none)
SELECT mean("P_active") FROM "Huawei" WHERE $timeFilter and time < ${__from}ms GROUP BY time(15m) fill(null)
SELECT mean("P_active") FROM "Huawei" WHERE $timeFilter and time > ${__from}ms GROUP BY time(15m) fill(null)
select cumulative_sum(diff)  as DBal from (SELECT ("P_Exp") - ("P_Grid") + ("Adj") as diff FROM "Huawei_daily"  fill(0)) where time > '${__to:date:YYYY-MM-18}' -60d

select (CBal) + (DBal) as Acct_Bal from (select cumulative_sum(diff)  as DBal from (SELECT ("P_Exp") - ("P_Grid") + ("Adj") as diff FROM "Huawei_daily"  fill(0)) where time > '${__to:date:YYYY-MM-18}' -60d), (select cumulative_sum(Bal) as CBal from Huawei_daily where time > now() -365d ) fill(previous)
select cumulative_sum(Bal) + cumulative_sum(Adj) from Huawei_daily where time > now() -365d fill(previous)
SELECT first("radiance") FROM "solar" WHERE time > now() - 61d  group by time(1d) fill(previous)  tz('${tzone}')
SELECT ("P_daily") FROM "Huawei_daily" WHERE time > now() - 31d
SELECT  ("P_Exp") as export FROM "Huawei_daily" WHERE time > now() - 31d
SELECT ("P_Grid") FROM "Huawei_daily" WHERE time > now() - 31d
SELECT ("P_Load") FROM "Huawei_daily" WHERE time > now() - 31d
SELECT ("f_power") FROM "Huawei_daily" WHERE time > now() - 31d
SELECT min("M_P")/(-1000) FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 30d group by time(1d) fill(none) tz('${tzone}')
SELECT ("P_peak") FROM "Huawei_daily" WHERE time > now() - 31d
SELECT mean("P_daily") FROM "Huawei_daily" group by time(30d) tz('${tzone}')
SELECT mean("P_Exp") as export FROM "Huawei_daily" group by time(30d) tz('${tzone}')
SELECT mean("P_Load") FROM "Huawei_daily" group by time(30d) tz('${tzone}')
SELECT mean("P_peak") FROM "Huawei_daily" group by time(30d) tz('${tzone}')
SELECT mean("P_Grid") FROM "Huawei_daily" group by time(30d) tz('${tzone}')
SELECT mean("f_power") FROM "Huawei_daily"  GROUP BY time(30d) tz('${tzone}')
SELECT mean("f_power90") FROM "Huawei_daily"  GROUP BY time(30d) tz('${tzone}')
SELECT sum("P_daily") FROM "Huawei_daily" where time > '${__to:date:YYYY-MM-18}' - 800d  group by time(30d) tz('${tzone}')
SELECT sum("P_Exp") as export FROM "Huawei_daily" where time > '${__to:date:YYYY-MM-18}' -800d  group by time(30d) tz('${tzone}')
SELECT sum("f_power") FROM "Huawei_daily" where time > '${__to:date:YYYY-MM-18}' -800d  group by time(30d) tz('${tzone}')
SELECT sum("P_Load") FROM "Huawei_daily" where time > '${__to:date:YYYY-MM-18}' -800d  group by time(30d) tz('${tzone}')
SELECT sum("P_Grid") FROM "Huawei_daily" where time > '${__to:date:YYYY-MM-18}' -800d  group by time(30d) tz('${tzone}')
SELECT cumulative_sum(Bal)  FROM "Huawei_daily" where time > '${__to:date:YYYY-MM-18}' - 800d tz('${tzone}')
SELECT sum("P_daily") FROM "Huawei_daily"  group by time(365d) tz('${tzone}')
SELECT sum("P_Exp") as export FROM "Huawei_daily"  group by time(365d) tz('${tzone}')
SELECT sum("f_power") FROM "Huawei_daily"  group by time(365d) tz('${tzone}')
SELECT sum("P_Load") FROM "Huawei_daily"  group by time(365d) tz('${tzone}')
SELECT sum("P_Grid") FROM "Huawei_daily"  group by time(365d) tz('${tzone}')
SELECT cumulative_sum(Bal)  FROM "Huawei_daily"   group by time(365d) tz('${tzone}')
select max(l) - min(f)  from (SELECT first("M_PExp") as f FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 366d ), (SELECT last("M_PExp") as l  FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 1d)
select max(l) - min(f)  from (SELECT first("M_PTot") as f FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 366d ), (SELECT last("M_PTot") as l  FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 1d)
select max(l) - min(f)  from (SELECT first("P_accum") as f FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 366d ), (SELECT last("P_accum") as l  FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 1d)
select max(l) - min(f)  from (SELECT first("M_PExp") as f FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 181d  ), (SELECT last("M_PExp") as l  FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 1d)
select max(l) - min(f)  from (SELECT first("M_PTot") as f FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 181d  ), (SELECT last("M_PTot") as l  FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 1d)
select max(l) - min(f)  from (SELECT first("P_accum") as f FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 181d ), (SELECT last("P_accum") as l  FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 1d)
select max(l) - min(f)  from (SELECT first("M_PExp") as f FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 91d ), (SELECT last("M_PExp") as l  FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 1d)
select max(l) - min(f)  from (SELECT first("M_PTot") as f FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 90d ), (SELECT last("M_PTot") as l  FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 1d)
select max(l) - min(f)  from (SELECT first("P_accum") as f FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 90d ), (SELECT last("P_accum") as l  FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 1d)
select max(l) - min(f)  from (SELECT first("M_PExp") as f FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 31d ), (SELECT max("M_PExp") as l  FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 1d)
select max(l) - min(f)  from (SELECT first("M_PTot") as f FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 31d  and time < now() - 25d), (SELECT last("M_PTot") as l  FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 1d)
select max(l) - min(f)  from (SELECT first("P_accum") as f FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 31d  and time < now() - 25d), (SELECT last("P_accum") as l  FROM "Huawei" WHERE time > now() - 1d)
SELECT (mean("P_active") * 1000) FROM "Huawei" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(previous)
SELECT "M_P" - (load_1) *800 - (load_2) *800 FROM "Huawei" WHERE $timeFilter fill(previous)
SELECT last(load_0)  FROM "Huawei" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time(30s) fill(none)
SELECT last(load_1)  FROM "Huawei" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time(30s) fill(none)
SELECT last(load_2)  FROM "Huawei" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time(30s) fill(none)
SELECT max(M_P)/mean(M_P) as spiky FROM "Huawei" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time(5m)
SELECT (1 - "f_hours") FROM "Huawei_daily"
SELECT ("f_ratio") FROM "Huawei_daily"
